  33def save_serializer_instance(serializer_instance):
  34    """
  35    Save instant using serializer and raise if any validation error.
  36
  37    Is is not valid acording to serializer validation, raise error.
  38
  39    Args:
  40        serializer_instance:
  41            Serializer with an object to be saved.
  42    Returns:
  43        New object updated or created.
  44    Raises:
  45        PumpWoodObjectSavingException:
  46            'Error when validating fields when saving object'. Raise error if
  47            validation of serializer is not correct. It will return error
  48            dictonary at error payload.
  49    """
  50    is_valid = serializer_instance.is_valid()
  51    if is_valid:
  52        return serializer_instance.save()
  53    else:
  54        raise exceptions.PumpWoodObjectSavingException(
  55            message="Error when validating fields when saving object",
  56            payload=serializer_instance.errors)

  59class PumpWoodRestService(viewsets.ViewSet):
  60    """
  61    Basic View-Set for pumpwood rest end-points.
  62
  63    Example:
  64    ```python
  65    from metabase.models import MetabaseDashboard
  66    from metabase.serializers import MetabaseDashboardSerializer
  67    from config import storage_object, microservice
  68
  69
  70    class RestMetabaseDashboard(PumpWoodRestService):
  71        endpoint_description = "Metabase Dashboard"
  72        notes = "Register and generate url to embed Metabase dashboards"
  73
  74        # Django model that will be mapped to this end-point
  75        service_model = MetabaseDashboard
  76
  77        # Serializer that will be used to dump model data
  78        serializer = MetabaseDashboardSerializer
  79
  80        # PumpwoodStorage object that will be used to save and retrieve
  81        # file data from storage.
  82        storage_object = storage_object
  83
  84        # PumpWoodMicroService object used to communicate with other
  85        # microservice if necessary. Ex: Trigger ETL Jobs on object
  86        # saving and update.
  87        microservice = microservice
  88
  89        # Fields that will be considered as files and extensions that
  90        # will be accepted.
  91        file_fields = {
  92            'file': ['json', 'xlsx']
  93        }
  94
  95        ###########################################################
  96        # Gui this information will be returned at retrieve_options
  97        # to help frontend correctly render app frontend.
  98        # Set field sets, grouping the fields and hiding those that
  99        # ar not listed on fieldsets
 100        gui_retrieve_fieldset = [{
 101                "name": "main",
 102                "fields": [
 103                    "status", "alias", "description", "notes",
 104                    "dimensions", "updated_by", "updated_at"]
 105            }, {
 106                "name": "embedding",
 107                "fields": [
 108                    "metabase_id", "auto_embedding", "object_model_class",
 109                    "object_pk"]
 110            }, {
 111                "name": "config",
 112                "fields": [
 113                    "expire_in_min", "default_theme",
 114                    "default_is_bordered", "default_is_titled"]
 115            }, {
 116                "name": "extra_info",
 117                "fields": ["extra_info"]
 118            }
 119        ]
 120
 121        # This fields will be set as readonly if fill_options_validation
 122        # is called with query parameter `?user_type=gui`
 123        gui_readonly = ["updated_by_id", "updated_at", "extra_info"]
 124
 125        # Indication how the object could be presented to user
 126        gui_verbose_field = '{pk} | {description}'
 127    ```
 128    """
 129
 130    _view_type = "simple"
 131    renderer_classes = [PumpwoodJSONRenderer]
 132
 133    #####################
 134    # Route information #
 135    endpoint_description: str = None
 136    """Description of the end-point, this information will be avaiable at
 137       `rest/pumpwood/endpoints/` for frontend. This information will be
 138       saved at KongRoute, it must be unique for all microservices"""
 139    dimensions: dict = {}
 140    """Dimensions associated with end-points. This information will be saved
 141       at KongRoute dimensions."""
 142    icon: str = None
 143    """Icon associated with model class. This information will be saved
 144       at KongRoute icon field."""
 145    #####################
 146
 147    service_model: models.Model
 148    """Django model associated end-points will be made avaiable."""
 149    storage_object: PumpWoodStorage
 150    """PumpwoodStorage object that will be used to save and retrieve
 151       file data from storage."""
 152    microservice: PumpWoodMicroService
 153    """PumpWoodMicroService object used to communicate with other
 154       microservice if necessary. Ex: Trigger ETL Jobs on object
 155       saving and update."""
 156    trigger: bool = False
 157    """If should be called ELTTrigger at ETL microservice at saving, deleting
 158       and executing actions. Default value is False."""
 159
 160    # List fields
 161    serializer: DynamicFieldsModelSerializer
 162    """Serializer that will be used to dump data on end-points."""
 163    file_fields = {}
 164    """File fields associated with model, it is a dictonary with keys as
 165       field keys and values as a list of accepted extensions."""
 166
 167    # Front-end uses 50 as limit to check if all data have been fetched,
 168    # if change this parameter, be sure to update front-end list component.
 169    list_paginate_limit: int = 50
 170    """List end-point pagination default limit."""
 171
 172    #######
 173    # Gui #
 174    gui_retrieve_fieldset: List[dict] = None
 175    """Retrieve field set to be passed to gui from `retrieve_view_options`.
 176       It is a list of dictonary with keys name for name of the viewset and
 177       fields for the fields that are associated.
 178
 179       Example:
 180       ```python
 181       gui_retrieve_fieldset = [{
 182               "name": "main",
 183               "fields": [
 184                   "status", "alias", "description", "notes",
 185                   "dimensions", "updated_by", "updated_at"]
 186           }, {
 187               "name": "embedding",
 188               "fields": [
 189                   "metabase_id", "auto_embedding", "object_model_class",
 190                   "object_pk"]
 191           }, {
 192               "name": "config",
 193               "fields": [
 194                   "expire_in_min", "default_theme",
 195                   "default_is_bordered", "default_is_titled"]
 196           }, {
 197               "name": "extra_info",
 198               "fields": ["extra_info"]
 199           }
 200       ]
 201       ```
 202    """
 203    gui_verbose_field: str = 'pk'
 204    """Suggest verbose for object using information from object. It is set
 205       as python string format, default `pk`. Ex: `{pk} | {description}` will
 206       use information from `pk` and `description` keys."""
 207    gui_readonly: List[str] = []
 208    """Set readonly fields when calling with `user_type=gui` for
 209       `fill_options_validation` end-point."""

 253    @classmethod
 254    def get_list_fields(cls):
 255        """
 256        Return list_fields from associated serializer.
 257
 258        This function can be overwriten to add custom funcionalities
 259        to get `cls.serializer().get_list_fields()` data.
 260
 261        Returns:
 262            Return list_fields for model.
 263        """
 264        serializer_obj = cls.serializer()
 265        return serializer_obj.get_list_fields()

 268    @staticmethod
 269    def _allowed_extension(filename, allowed_extensions):
 270        extension = 'none'
 271        if '.' in filename:
 272            extension = filename.rsplit('.', 1)[1].lower()
 273
 274        if "*" not in allowed_extensions:
 275            if extension not in allowed_extensions:
 276                return [(
 277                    "File {filename} with extension {extension} not " +
 278                    "allowed.\n Allowed extensions: {allowed_extensions}"
 279                ).format(filename=filename, extension=extension,
 280                         allowed_extensions=str(allowed_extensions))]
 281        return []
 282
 283    def list(self, request) -> List[dict]:
 284        """
 285        View function to list objects with pagination.
 286
 287        Number of objects are limited by. To get next page, use
 288        exclude_dict['pk__in': [list of the received pks]] to get more
 289        objects.
 290
 291        ..: notes:
 292            Models with deleted field will have objects with deleted=True
 293            excluded by default from results. To retrive these objects
 294            explicity define `exclude_dict` `{'deleted': None}` or
 295            `{'deleted': False}`.
 296
 297        Use to limit the query .query.filter_by_dict function. Request
 298        expected parameters and query parameters are listed bellow:
 299
 300        ###### Request payload data:
 301        - **filter_dict [dict] = {}:**
 302            Dictionary passed as `model.objects.filter(**filter_dict)`.<br>
 303        - **exclude_dict [dict] = {}:**
 304            Dictionary passed as
 305            `model.objects.exclude(**filter_dict)`.<br>
 306        - **order_by [dict] = []:**
 307            Dictionary passed as `model.objects.exclude(*order_by)`.<br>
 308        - **limit [int] = None:**
 309            Limit of the query result, if not set attribute
 310            `list_paginate_limit` will be used insted.<br>
 311        - **fields [List[str]] = []:**
 312            List of fields that should be returned on results objects.<br>
 313        - **default_fields [bool] = False:**
 314            If serializer `list_fields` should be used to filter the
 315            returned fields.<br>
 316        - **foreign_key_fields [bool] = False:**
 317            If foreign keys should be returned with object data.<br>
 318
 319        ###### Request query data:
 320        No query data.
 321
 322        Args:
 323            request: Django request object.
 324        Returns:
 325            Return the result of the query limited to
 326            `list_paginate_limit` attribute. Objects are serialized
 327            using `serializer` attribute.
 328        Raises:
 329            PumpWoodQueryException:
 330                Raise if any error when treating the request.
 331        """
 332        try:
 333            request_data = request.data
 334            limit = request_data.pop("limit", None)
 335            list_paginate_limit = limit or self.list_paginate_limit
 336
 337            # Serializer parameters
 338            fields = request_data.pop("fields", None)
 339            default_fields = request_data.pop("default_fields", False)
 340            foreign_key_fields = request_data.pop("foreign_key_fields", False)
 341
 342            ################################################################
 343            # Do not display deleted objects if not explicity set to display
 344            exclude_dict = request_data.get("exclude_dict", {})
 345            if hasattr(self.service_model, 'deleted'):
 346                exclude_dict_keys = exclude_dict.keys()
 347                any_delete = False
 348                for key in exclude_dict_keys:
 349                    first = key.split("__")[0]
 350                    if first == "deleted":
 351                        any_delete = True
 352                        break
 353                if not any_delete:
 354                    exclude_dict["deleted"] = True
 355            ################################################################
 356
 357            arg_dict = {'query_set': self.service_model.objects.all()}
 358            arg_dict.update(request_data)
 359            query_set = filter_by_dict(**arg_dict)[:list_paginate_limit]
 360
 361            return Response(self.serializer(
 362                query_set, many=True, fields=fields,
 363                foreign_key_fields=foreign_key_fields,
 364                default_fields=default_fields).data)
 365        except Exception as e:
 366            raise exceptions.PumpWoodQueryException(message=str(e))
 367
 368    def list_without_pag(self, request):
 369        """
 370        View function to list objects **without** pagination.
 371
 372        ..: notes:
 373            Models with deleted field will have objects with deleted=True
 374            excluded by default from results. To retrive these objects
 375            explicity define `exclude_dict` `{'deleted': None}` or
 376            `{'deleted': False}`.
 377
 378        .. warning::
 379            Be careful with the number of the objects that will be fetched!
 380            This end-point does not paginate data returning all information
 381            of query result.
 382
 383        ###### Request payload data:
 384        - **filter_dict [dict] = {}:**
 385            Dictionary passed as `model.objects.filter(**filter_dict)`.<br>
 386        - **exclude_dict [dict] = {}:**
 387            Dictionary passed as
 388            `model.objects.exclude(**filter_dict)`.<br>
 389        - **order_by [dict] = []:**
 390            Dictionary passed as `model.objects.exclude(*order_by)`.<br>
 391        - **fields [List[str]] = []:**
 392            List of fields that should be returned on results objects.<br>
 393        - **default_fields [bool] = False:**
 394            If serializer `list_fields` should be used to filter the
 395            returned fields.<br>
 396        - **foreign_key_fields [bool] = False:**
 397            If foreign keys should be returned with object data.<br>
 398
 399        ###### Request query data:
 400        No query data.
 401
 402        Args:
 403            request: Django request object.
 404        Returns:
 405            Return the result of the query **without** pagination . Objects
 406            are serialized using `serializer` attribute.
 407        Raises:
 408            PumpWoodQueryException:
 409                Raise if any error when treating the request.
 410        """
 411        try:
 412            request_data = request.data
 413
 414            # Serializer parameters
 415            fields = request_data.pop("fields", None)
 416            default_fields = request_data.pop("default_fields", False)
 417            foreign_key_fields = request_data.pop("foreign_key_fields", False)
 418
 419            ################################################################
 420            # Do not display deleted objects if not explicity set to display
 421            exclude_dict = request_data.get("exclude_dict", {})
 422            if hasattr(self.service_model, 'deleted'):
 423                exclude_dict_keys = exclude_dict.keys()
 424                any_delete = False
 425                for key in exclude_dict_keys:
 426                    first = key.split("__")[0]
 427                    if first == "deleted":
 428                        any_delete = True
 429                        break
 430                if not any_delete:
 431                    exclude_dict["deleted"] = True
 432            ################################################################
 433
 434            arg_dict = {'query_set': self.service_model.objects.all()}
 435            arg_dict.update(request_data)
 436
 437            query_set = filter_by_dict(**arg_dict)
 438            return Response(self.serializer(
 439                query_set, many=True, fields=fields,
 440                default_fields=default_fields,
 441                foreign_key_fields=foreign_key_fields).data)
 442
 443        except TypeError as e:
 444            raise exceptions.PumpWoodQueryException(
 445                message=str(e))
 446
 447    def retrieve(self, request, pk=None) -> dict:
 448        """
 449        Retrieve view, uses the retrieve_serializer to return object with pk.
 450
 451        Query parameters are loaded as json data, ex:
 452        `json.loads(request.query_params.get('fields', 'null'))`
 453
 454        ###### Request payload data:
 455        GET request only, does not have payload.
 456
 457        ###### Request query data:
 458        - **fields [List[str]] = None:** List of the fields that should be
 459            returned.
 460        - **foreign_key_fields [bool] = False:** If foreign key should be
 461            returned with object data.
 462        - **related_fields [bool] = False:** If related fields should be
 463            returned with object data.
 464        - **default_fields [bool] = False:** If only serializer list_fields
 465            should be returned.
 466
 467        Args:
 468            request [pk]:
 469                Django request.
 470            int [pk]:
 471                Object pk to be retrieve
 472        Returns:
 473            The representation of the object with pk dumped by
 474            self.serializer using arguments passed on query parameters.
 475        """
 476        ##########################
 477        # Get serializer options #
 478        fields = json.loads(
 479            request.query_params.get('fields', 'null'))
 480        foreign_key_fields = json.loads(
 481            request.query_params.get('foreign_key_fields', 'false'))
 482        related_fields = json.loads(
 483            request.query_params.get('related_fields', 'false'))
 484        default_fields = json.loads(
 485            request.query_params.get('default_fields', 'false'))
 486        ##########################
 487
 488        obj = self.service_model.objects.get(pk=pk)
 489        response_data = self.serializer(
 490            obj, many=False, fields=fields,
 491            foreign_key_fields=foreign_key_fields,
 492            related_fields=related_fields,
 493            default_fields=default_fields).data
 494        return Response(response_data)
 495
 496    def retrieve_file(self, request, pk: int) -> bytes:
 497        """
 498        Read file without stream.
 499
 500        .. warning::
 501            This end-point will read de file from storage and them return the
 502            request. Be carefull when retriving large files (greater than
 503            10Mb).
 504
 505        ###### Request payload data:
 506        GET request only, does not have payload.
 507
 508        ###### Request query data:
 509        - **file_field [str]:** File field to receive stream file.
 510            returned with object data.
 511
 512        Args:
 513            pk [int]:
 514                Pk of the object to save file field.
 515        Returns:
 516            Return a file associated with object pk, file field `file_field`
 517            read from storage.
 518        Raises:
 519            PumpWoodForbidden:
 520                '{field} must be set on file_fields dictionary.'. Indicates
 521                that the requested file field was not found on view
 522                `file_fields` attribute.
 523            PumpWoodForbidden:
 524                'storage_object not set'. Indicates that the `storage_object`
 525                attribute is not set at view. This view can not perform
 526                file operations.
 527            PumpWoodObjectDoesNotExist:
 528                'field [{}] is not set at object'. Indicates that requested
 529                file field is not set on object.
 530        """
 531        if self.storage_object is None:
 532            raise exceptions.PumpWoodForbidden(
 533                "storage_object not set")
 534
 535        file_field = request.query_params.get('file_field', None)
 536        if file_field not in self.file_fields.keys():
 537            msg = (
 538                "'{field}' must be set on file_fields dictionary."
 539            ).format(field=file_field)
 540            raise exceptions.PumpWoodForbidden(
 541                msg, payload={
 542                    'field': file_field,
 543                    file_field: 'not_found'})
 544
 545        obj = self.service_model.objects.get(id=pk)
 546        file_path = getattr(obj, file_field)
 547        if isinstance(file_path, FieldFile):
 548            file_path = file_path.name
 549
 550        if not file_path:
 551            raise exceptions.PumpWoodObjectDoesNotExist(
 552                "field [{}] is not set at object".format(file_field))
 553        file_data = self.storage_object.read_file(file_path)
 554        file_name = os.path.basename(file_path)
 555
 556        response = HttpResponse(content=BytesIO(file_data["data"]))
 557        response['Content-Type'] = file_data["content_type"]
 558        response['Content-Disposition'] = \
 559            'attachment; filename=%s' % file_name
 560        return response
 561
 562    def delete(self, request, pk=None) -> dict:
 563        """
 564        Delete view.
 565
 566        .. notes::
 567            If model has deleted field, the default behaviour will set this
 568            field to True not deleting the object. To force deletion it is
 569            necessary to use query paramenter `force_delete=True`
 570
 571        ###### Request payload data:
 572        GET request only, does not have payload.
 573
 574        ###### Request query data:
 575        - **force_delete [bool] = False:** Force deletion of models that
 576            have `deleted` field. If False, object with deleted
 577            will not be deleted, but deleted will be set as True.
 578
 579        Args:
 580            request: Django request.
 581            pk [int]: Object pk to be retrieve.
 582        Returns:
 583            Return the object that was removed.
 584        """
 585        obj = self.service_model.objects.get(pk=pk)
 586        force_delete = json.loads(request.query_params.get(
 587            'force_delete', 'false'))
 588        return_data = self.serializer(obj, many=False).data
 589
 590        # If object has deleted field, set it to True if force_delete
 591        # parameter is not set, this will function for objects that
 592        # deletion is not a good pratice for keep data audit.
 593        if hasattr(obj, 'deleted') and not force_delete:
 594            obj.deleted = True
 595            obj.save()
 596        else:
 597            obj.delete()
 598        return Response(return_data, status=200)
 599
 600    def delete_many(self, request) -> bool:
 601        """
 602        Delete many data using filter.
 603
 604        .. warning::
 605            This action will delete all objects that satisfies the query
 606            filter_dict and exclude_dict. It will also delete objects with
 607            deleted fields. **THIS REQUEST CAN NOT BE UNDONE**.
 608
 609        ###### Request payload data:
 610        GET request only, does not have payload.
 611
 612        ###### Request query data:
 613        - **filter_dict [dict] = {}:**
 614            Dictionary passed as `model.objects.filter(**filter_dict)`.<br>
 615        - **exclude_dict [dict] = {}:**
 616            Dictionary passed as
 617            `model.objects.exclude(**filter_dict)`.<br>
 618
 619        Args:
 620            request: Django request.
 621        Returns:
 622            True if operation has completed.
 623        Raises:
 624            PumpWoodObjectDeleteException:
 625                If any error raised when performing request.
 626        """
 627        try:
 628            arg_dict = {'query_set': self.service_model.objects.all()}
 629            arg_dict.update(request.data)
 630
 631            query_set = filter_by_dict(**arg_dict)
 632            query_set.delete()
 633            return Response(True, status=200)
 634        except Exception as e:
 635            raise exceptions.PumpWoodObjectDeleteException(
 636                message=str(e))
 637
 638    def remove_file_field(self, request, pk: int) -> bool:
 639        """
 640        Remove file field.
 641
 642        ###### Request payload data:
 643        GET request only, does not have payload.
 644
 645        ###### Request query data:
 646        - **file_field [str]:**
 647            File field associated with a file that will be removed.<br>
 648
 649        Args:
 650            request: Django request.
 651            pk [int]: pk of the object.
 652        Returns:
 653            True if the object was removed.
 654        Raises:
 655            PumpWoodForbidden:
 656                'file_field must be set on self.file_fields dictionary.'.
 657                Indicates that `file_file` is not in file_fields keys of
 658                the view.
 659            PumpWoodObjectDoesNotExist:
 660                'field [{}] not found at object'. Indicates that file was not
 661                found on storage.
 662        """
 663        file_field = request.query_params.get('file_field', None)
 664        if file_field not in self.file_fields.keys():
 665            raise exceptions.PumpWoodForbidden(
 666                "file_field must be set on self.file_fields dictionary.")
 667        obj = self.service_model.objects.get(id=pk)
 668
 669        file = getattr(obj, file_field)
 670        if file is None:
 671            raise exceptions.PumpWoodObjectDoesNotExist(
 672                "field [{}] not found at object".format(file_field))
 673        else:
 674            file_path = file.name
 675        setattr(obj, file_field, None)
 676        obj.save()
 677
 678        try:
 679            self.storage_object.delete_file(file_path)
 680            return Response(True)
 681        except Exception as e:
 682            raise exceptions.PumpWoodException(str(e))
 683
 684    def save(self, request) -> dict:
 685        """
 686        Save and update object acording to request.data.
 687
 688        Object will be updated if request.data['pk'] is not None.
 689
 690        ###### Request payload data:
 691        Object to be saved. If a pk is set them the object will be updated,
 692        if pk is None or not set a new object will be created.
 693
 694        ###### Request query data:
 695        No query parameters.
 696
 697        Args:
 698            request: Django request.
 699        Returns:
 700            Serialized new/updated object.
 701
 702        Raises:
 703            PumpWoodException:
 704                'Object model class diferent from {service_model} :
 705                {service_model}'. Indicates that the end-point and the
 706                model_class of the object are impatible.
 707            PumpWoodObjectSavingException:
 708                'Error when validating fields when saving object'. Indicates
 709                that there were error when validating object
 710                at the serializer. Error payload will have the fields with
 711                error as keys of the dictonary.
 712        """
 713        request_data: dict = None
 714        if "application/json" in request.content_type.lower():
 715            request_data = request.data
 716        else:
 717            request_data = request.data.dict()
 718            json_data = json.loads(request_data.pop("__json__", '{}'))
 719            request_data.update(json_data)
 720
 721        data_pk = request_data.get('pk')
 722        saved_obj = None
 723        for field in self.file_fields.keys():
 724            request_data.pop(field, None)
 725
 726        # update
 727        if data_pk:
 728            data_to_update = self.service_model.objects.get(pk=data_pk)
 729            serializer = self.serializer(
 730                data_to_update, data=request_data,
 731                context={'request': request})
 732            saved_obj = save_serializer_instance(serializer)
 733            response_status = status.HTTP_200_OK
 734        # save
 735        else:
 736            serializer = self.serializer(
 737                data=request_data, context={'request': request})
 738            saved_obj = save_serializer_instance(serializer)
 739            response_status = status.HTTP_201_CREATED
 740
 741        # Uploading files
 742        object_errors = {}
 743        file_save_time = datetime.datetime.utcnow().strftime(
 744            "%Y-%m-%dT%Hh%Mm%Ss")
 745        for field in self.file_fields.keys():
 746            field_errors = []
 747            if field in request.FILES:
 748                file = request.FILES[field]
 749
 750                file_name = secure_filename(file.name)
 751                field_errors.extend(self._allowed_extension(
 752                    filename=file_name,
 753                    allowed_extensions=self.file_fields[field]))
 754
 755                filename = "{}___{}___{}".format(
 756                    str(saved_obj.id).zfill(15),
 757                    file_save_time,
 758                    file_name)
 759                if len(field_errors) != 0:
 760                    object_errors[field] = field_errors
 761                else:
 762                    model_class = self.service_model.__name__.lower()
 763                    file_path = '{model_class}__{field}/'.format(
 764                        model_class=model_class, field=field)
 765                    storage_filepath = self.storage_object.write_file(
 766                        file_path=file_path, file_name=filename,
 767                        data=file.read(),
 768                        content_type=file.content_type,
 769                        if_exists='overide')
 770                    setattr(saved_obj, field, storage_filepath)
 771
 772        if object_errors != {}:
 773            message = "error when saving object: " \
 774                if data_pk is None else "error when updating object: "
 775            payload = object_errors
 776            message_to_append = []
 777            for key, value in object_errors.items():
 778                message_to_append.append(key + ", " + str(value))
 779            message = message + "; ".join(message_to_append)
 780            raise exceptions.PumpWoodObjectSavingException(
 781                message=message, payload=payload)
 782        saved_obj.save()
 783
 784        if self.microservice is not None and self.trigger:
 785            # Process ETLTrigger for the model class
 786            self.microservice.login()
 787            if data_pk is None:
 788                self.microservice.execute_action(
 789                    "ETLTrigger", action="process_triggers", parameters={
 790                        "model_class": self.service_model.__name__.lower(),
 791                        "type": "create",
 792                        "pk": None,
 793                        "action_name": None})
 794            else:
 795                self.microservice.execute_action(
 796                    "ETLTrigger", action="process_triggers", parameters={
 797                        "model_class": self.service_model.__name__.lower(),
 798                        "type": "update",
 799                        "pk": saved_obj.pk,
 800                        "action_name": None})
 801
 802        # Overhead, serializando e deserializando o objecto
 803        return Response(
 804            self.serializer(saved_obj).data, status=response_status)
 805
 806    def _get_actions(self):
 807        """
 808        Get all actions with action decorator.
 809
 810        @private
 811        """
 812        # this import works here only
 813        import inspect
 814        function_dict = dict(inspect.getmembers(
 815            self.service_model, predicate=inspect.isfunction))
 816        method_dict = dict(inspect.getmembers(
 817            self.service_model, predicate=inspect.ismethod))
 818        method_dict.update(function_dict)
 819        actions = {
 820            name: func for name, func in method_dict.items()
 821            if getattr(func, 'is_action', False)}
 822        return actions
 823
 824    def list_actions(self, request) -> List[dict]:
 825        """
 826        List model exposed actions.
 827
 828        ###### Request payload data:
 829        No payload.
 830
 831        ###### Request query data:
 832        No query parameters.
 833
 834        Args:
 835            request: Django request.
 836        Returns:
 837            Return a list of dictonary with information of the avaiable
 838            actions for model class. Actions info object keys:
 839            - **action_name [str]:** Name of the function associated with
 840                action on model_class.
 841            - **action_name__verbose [str]:** Name of the function associated
 842                with action on model_class translates by Pumpwood I8s.
 843            - **doc_string [str]:** Doc string associated with function.
 844            - **info [str]:** Info for que action passed as argument at action
 845                function decorator.
 846            - **info__verbose [str]:** Info for que action passed as argument
 847                at action function decorator model_class translates by
 848                Pumpwood I8s.
 849            - **is_static_function [bool]:** Boolean value setting if function
 850                is classmethod or staticmethod (True), in this cases it is not
 851                associated with an object and aa pk should no be passed as
 852                argument.
 853            - **parameters [dict]:** Dictionary with paramenter as key and with
 854                keys:
 855                - **default_value [any]:** Default value for paramenter.
 856                - **many [bool]:** If the function parameter is many (list).
 857                - **required [bool]:** If the parameter is necessary to run the
 858                    function or optinal.
 859                - **type [str]:** Type of the paramenter that shoul be passed
 860                    to function.
 861                - **verbose_name [str]:** Parameter name translated using
 862                    Pumpwood I8s.
 863            - **return [dict]:** A dictionary with the type associated with
 864                function return. Keys:
 865                - **many [bool]:** If the return result is a list.
 866                - **type [str]:** Type of the return.
 867        """
 868        actions = self._get_actions()
 869        action_descriptions = []
 870        translation_tag_template = "{model_class}__action__{action}"
 871        model_class = self.service_model.__name__
 872        for name, action in actions.items():
 873            action_dict = action.action_object.to_dict()
 874            tag = translation_tag_template.format(
 875                model_class=model_class,
 876                action=action_dict["action_name"])
 877
 878            #########################################################
 879            # Translate action_name and info to end-user at verbose #
 880            action_dict["action_name__verbose"] = _.t(
 881                sentence=action_dict["action_name"], tag=tag + "__action_name")
 882            action_dict["info__verbose"] = _.t(
 883                sentence=action_dict["info"], tag=tag + "__info")
 884            for key, item in action_dict["parameters"].items():
 885                item["verbose_name"] = _.t(
 886                    sentence=key, tag=tag + "__parameters")
 887            #########################################################
 888            action_descriptions.append(action_dict)
 889
 890        return Response(action_descriptions)
 891
 892    def execute_action(self, request, action_name, pk=None) -> dict:
 893        """
 894        Execute action over object or class using parameters.
 895
 896        ###### Request payload data:
 897        Payload dictionary correspont to function parameters as key->value
 898        elements.
 899
 900        ###### Request query data:
 901        No query parameters.
 902
 903        Args:
 904            request:
 905                Django request.
 906            action_name [str]:
 907                Action name.
 908            pk [pk]:
 909                Of the object that will be used to run the action. For
 910                staticmethods and classmethods the object should not be
 911                passed as argument.
 912        Returns:
 913            Return a dictonary with keys:
 914            -
 915        Raises:
 916            PumpWoodActionArgsException:
 917                'Action [{action}] at model [{class_name}] is not
 918                a classmethod and not pk provided.'. Indicates that the action
 919                is not a classmethod and the pk was not passed as function
 920                argument.
 921            PumpWoodActionArgsException:
 922                'Action [{action}] at model [{class_name}] is a
 923                classmethod and pk provided.'. Indicates that the action is
 924                a classmethod, but a pk was passed as argument.
 925            PumpWoodObjectDoesNotExist:
 926                'Requested object {service_model}[{pk}] not found.'.
 927                Indicates that the object with [pk] was not found on
 928                database.
 929            PumpWoodActionArgsException:
 930                'error when unserializing function arguments: [...]'.
 931                Indicates that it was not possible to unserialize objects
 932                passed as function arguments. Pumpwood used function tips
 933                types to convert the arguments on correct types before
 934                passing them to function.
 935        """
 936        parameters = request.data
 937        actions = self._get_actions()
 938        rest_action_names = list(actions.keys())
 939
 940        if action_name not in rest_action_names:
 941            message = (
 942                "There is no method {action} in rest actions "
 943                "for {class_name}").format(
 944                    action=action_name,
 945                    class_name=self.service_model.__name__)
 946            raise exceptions.PumpWoodForbidden(
 947                message=message, payload={"action_name": action_name})
 948
 949        action = getattr(self.service_model, action_name)
 950        if pk is None and not action.action_object.is_static_function:
 951            msg_template = (
 952                "Action [{action}] at model [{class_name}] is not "
 953                "a classmethod and not pk provided.")
 954            message = msg_template.format(
 955                action=action_name,
 956                class_name=self.service_model.__name__)
 957            raise exceptions.PumpWoodActionArgsException(
 958                message=message, payload={"action_name": action_name})
 959
 960        if pk is not None and action.action_object.is_static_function:
 961            msg_template = (
 962                "Action [{action}] at model [{class_name}] is a"
 963                "classmethod and pk provided.")
 964            message = msg_template.format(
 965                action=action_name,
 966                class_name=self.service_model.__name__)
 967            raise exceptions.PumpWoodActionArgsException(
 968                message=message, payload={"action_name": action_name})
 969
 970        object_dict = None
 971        action = None
 972        if pk is not None:
 973            model_object = self.service_model.objects.filter(pk=pk).first()
 974            if model_object is None:
 975                message_template = (
 976                    "Requested object {service_model}[{pk}] not found.")
 977                temp_service_model = \
 978                    self.service_model.__name__
 979                message = message_template.format(
 980                    service_model=temp_service_model, pk=pk)
 981                raise exceptions.PumpWoodObjectDoesNotExist(
 982                    message=message, payload={
 983                        "service_model": temp_service_model, "pk": pk})
 984
 985            action = getattr(model_object, action_name)
 986            object_dict = self.serializer(model_object, many=False).data
 987        else:
 988            action = getattr(self.service_model, action_name)
 989
 990        loaded_parameters = load_action_parameters(action, parameters, request)
 991        result = action(**loaded_parameters)
 992
 993        if self.microservice is not None and self.trigger:
 994            self.microservice.login()
 995            self.microservice.execute_action(
 996                "ETLTrigger", action="process_triggers", parameters={
 997                    "model_class": self.service_model.__name__.lower(),
 998                    "type": "action", "pk": pk, "action_name": action_name})
 999
1000        return Response({
1001            'result': result, 'action': action_name,
1002            'parameters': parameters, 'object': object_dict})
1003
1004    @classmethod
1005    def cls_fields_options(cls) -> dict:
1006        """
1007        Return field options using serializer.
1008
1009        Args:
1010            No args.
1011        Returns:
1012            Return information for each column to render search filters on
1013            frontend. Each field will have:
1014            - **column [str]:** Name of the column associated with the
1015                field (same as the key).
1016            - **column__verbose [str]:** Name of the collumns translated
1017                using Pumpwood I8s.
1018            - **default [str]:** Defult value for column.
1019            - **extra_info [str]:** Extra information for the collumns
1020                can be used to pass information about foreign key or
1021                related fields.
1022            - **help_text [str]:** Help text associated with the collumn.
1023            - **help_text__verbose [str]:** Help text associated with the
1024                collumn translated using Pumpwood I8s.
1025            - **indexed [str]:** If this column is indexed.
1026            - **nullable [str]:** If this column is nullable.
1027            - **primary_key [str]:** If this column is part of the primary
1028                key of the table. This is use full for tables with
1029                composite pk.
1030            - **read_only [str]:** If this column is read-only on
1031                end-point. The results for this value may differ from
1032                fill_validation due to `gui_readonly`.
1033            - **type [str]:** Type of the column, will return Python types.
1034            - **unique [str]:** If this column has an unique restriction.
1035            - **in [str]:** If column type is options, this key will
1036                indicates the accepted values for this field. This element
1037                is a dictonary with keys:
1038                - **description:** Human readble value for option.
1039                - **description__verbose:** Human readble value for
1040                    option translated by Pumpwood I8s.
1041                - **value:** Value of the option that will be saved on
1042                    database, for save end-points use this value to
1043                    modify the object.
1044        """
1045        fields = cls.service_model._meta.get_fields()
1046        dict_fields = {}
1047        for f in fields:
1048            is_relation = getattr(f, "is_relation", False)
1049            primary_key = getattr(f, "primary_key", False)
1050            if not is_relation or primary_key:
1051                dict_fields[f.column] = f
1052
1053        model_class = cls.service_model.__name__
1054        translation_tag_template = "{model_class}__fields__{field}"
1055
1056        # Get read-only fields from serializer
1057        read_only_fields = getattr(cls.serializer.Meta, "read_only_fields", [])
1058
1059        # Get field serializers
1060        serializer_fields = cls.serializer(
1061            foreign_key_fields=True, related_fields=True).fields
1062
1063        # Get serializers associated with FKs and related models
1064        microservice_fk_dict = {}
1065        microservice_related_dict = {}
1066
1067        all_info = {}
1068        for field_name, field_serializer in serializer_fields.items():
1069            ################################################################
1070            # Do not create relations between models in search description #
1071            is_microservice_fk = isinstance(
1072                field_serializer, MicroserviceForeignKeyField)
1073            is_local_fk = isinstance(
1074                field_serializer, LocalForeignKeyField)
1075            if is_microservice_fk or is_local_fk:
1076                field_key = field_serializer.get_fields_options_key()
1077                microservice_fk_dict[field_key] = field_serializer
1078
1079            is_microservice_related = isinstance(
1080                field_serializer, MicroserviceRelatedField)
1081            is_local_related = isinstance(
1082                field_serializer, LocalRelatedField)
1083            if is_microservice_related or is_local_related:
1084                field_key = field_serializer.get_fields_options_key()
1085                microservice_related_dict[field_key] = field_serializer
1086
1087            f = dict_fields.get(field_serializer.source)
1088            if f is None:
1089                continue
1090            ################################################################
1091
1092            column_info = {}
1093
1094            # Getting correspondent simple type
1095            column_type = f.get_internal_type()
1096            python_type = django_map.get(column_type)
1097            if python_type is None:
1098                msg = (
1099                    "Type [{column_type}] not implemented in map dictionary "
1100                    "django type -> python type")
1101                raise NotImplementedError(
1102                    msg.format(column_type=column_type))
1103
1104            # Getting default value
1105            default = None
1106            f_default = getattr(f, 'default', None)
1107            if f_default != NOT_PROVIDED and f_default is not None:
1108                if callable(f_default):
1109                    default = f_default()
1110                else:
1111                    default = f_default
1112
1113            primary_key = getattr(f, "primary_key", False)
1114            help_text = str(getattr(f, "help_text", ""))
1115            db_index = getattr(f, "db_index", False)
1116            unique = getattr(f, "unique", False)
1117
1118            column = None
1119            if primary_key:
1120                column = "pk"
1121            else:
1122                column = f.column
1123
1124            tag = translation_tag_template.format(
1125                model_class=model_class, field=column)
1126            column__verbose = _.t(
1127                sentence=column, tag=tag + "__column")
1128            help_text__verbose = _.t(
1129                sentence=help_text, tag=tag + "__help_text")
1130            column_info = {
1131                'primary_key': primary_key,
1132                "column": column,
1133                "column__verbose": column__verbose,
1134                "help_text": help_text,
1135                "help_text__verbose": help_text__verbose,
1136                "type": python_type,
1137                "nullable": f.null,
1138                "default": default,
1139                "indexed": db_index or primary_key,
1140                "unique": unique,
1141                "read_only": (
1142                    (column in read_only_fields) or
1143                    (field_name == 'pk')
1144                ), "extra_info": {}}
1145
1146            # Get choice options if avaiable
1147            choices = getattr(f, "choices", None)
1148            if choices is not None:
1149                column_info["type"] = "options"
1150                in_list = {}
1151                for choice in choices:
1152                    description = _.t(
1153                        sentence=choice[1], tag=tag + "__choices")
1154                    in_list[choice[0]] = {
1155                        "description": choice[1],
1156                        "description__verbose": description,
1157                        "value": choice[0]}
1158                column_info["in"] = in_list
1159
1160            # Set autoincrement for primary keys
1161            if primary_key:
1162                column_info["column"] = "pk"
1163                column_info["default"] = "#autoincrement#"
1164                column_info["doc_string"] = "object primary key"
1165
1166            # Ajust type if file
1167            file_field = cls.file_fields.get(column)
1168            if file_field is not None:
1169                column_info["type"] = "file"
1170                column_info["extra_info"] = {
1171                    "permited_file_types": file_field}
1172            all_info[column] = column_info
1173
1174        #############################################
1175        # Adding field description for foreign keys #
1176        for key, item in microservice_fk_dict.items():
1177            column = getattr(cls.service_model, key, None)
1178            if column is None:
1179                msg = (
1180                    "Foreign Key [{key}] was not found as model_class "
1181                    "[{model_class}] fields")
1182                raise exceptions.PumpWoodOtherException(
1183                    message=msg,
1184                    payload={"key": key, "model_class": model_class})
1185
1186            tag = translation_tag_template.format(
1187                model_class=model_class, field=key)
1188
1189            primary_key = getattr(column.field, "primary_key", False)
1190            help_text = str(getattr(column.field, "help_text", ""))
1191            db_index = getattr(column.field, "db_index", False)
1192            unique = getattr(column.field, "unique", False)
1193            null = getattr(column.field, "null", False)
1194
1195            # Getting default value
1196            default = None
1197            f_default = getattr(f, 'default', None)
1198            if f_default != NOT_PROVIDED and f_default is not None:
1199                if callable(f_default):
1200                    default = f_default()
1201                else:
1202                    default = f_default
1203
1204            column__verbose = _.t(
1205                sentence=key, tag=tag + "__column")
1206            help_text__verbose = _.t(
1207                sentence=help_text, tag=tag + "__help_text")
1208            column_info = {
1209                'primary_key': primary_key,
1210                "column": key,
1211                'column__verbose': column__verbose,
1212                "help_text": help_text,
1213                'help_text__verbose': help_text__verbose,
1214                "type": "foreign_key",
1215                "nullable": null,
1216                "default": default,
1217                "indexed": db_index or primary_key,
1218                "unique": unique,
1219                "read_only": key in read_only_fields,
1220                "extra_info": item.to_dict()}
1221            all_info[key] = column_info
1222
1223        #############################################
1224        # Adding field description for foreign keys #
1225        for key, item in microservice_related_dict.items():
1226            tag = translation_tag_template.format(
1227                model_class=model_class, field=key)
1228
1229            column__verbose = _.t(
1230                sentence=key, tag=tag + "__column")
1231            help_text__verbose = _.t(
1232                sentence=help_text, tag=tag + "__help_text")
1233            column_info = {
1234                'primary_key': False,
1235                "column": key,
1236                'column__verbose': column__verbose,
1237                "help_text": help_text,
1238                'help_text__verbose': help_text__verbose,
1239                "type": "related_model",
1240                "nullable": True,
1241                "default": default,
1242                "indexed": False,
1243                "unique": False,
1244                "read_only": False,
1245                "extra_info": item.to_dict()}
1246            all_info[key] = column_info
1247        return all_info
1248
1249    def search_options(self, request):
1250        """
1251        Return options to be used in list funciton.
1252
1253        THIS END-POINT IS DEPRECTED
1254        """
1255        return Response(self.cls_fields_options())
1256
1257    def fill_options(self, request):
1258        """
1259        Return options for object update acording its partial data.
1260
1261        THIS END-POINT IS DEPRECTED
1262        """
1263        return Response(self.cls_fields_options())
1264
1265    def list_view_options(self, request) -> dict:
1266        """
1267        Return information to render list views on frontend.
1268
1269        ###### Request payload data:
1270        No payload data.
1271
1272        ###### Request query data:
1273        No query parameters.
1274
1275        Args:
1276            request: Django request.
1277        Returns:
1278            Return a dictionary with keys:
1279            - **list_fields[List[str]]:** Return a list of default list fields
1280                that should be redendered on list view.
1281            - **field_type [dict]:** Return information for each column to
1282                render search filters on frontend. Each field will have:
1283                - **column [str]:** Name of the column associated with the
1284                    field (same as the key).
1285                - **column__verbose [str]:** Name of the collumns translated
1286                    using Pumpwood I8s.
1287                - **default [str]:** Defult value for column.
1288                - **extra_info [str]:** Extra information for the collumns
1289                    can be used to pass information about foreign key or
1290                    related fields.
1291                - **help_text [str]:** Help text associated with the collumn.
1292                - **help_text__verbose [str]:** Help text associated with the
1293                    collumn translated using Pumpwood I8s.
1294                - **indexed [str]:** If this column is indexed.
1295                - **nullable [str]:** If this column is nullable.
1296                - **primary_key [str]:** If this column is part of the primary
1297                    key of the table. This is use full for tables with
1298                    composite pk.
1299                - **read_only [str]:** If this column is read-only on
1300                    end-point. The results for this value may differ from
1301                    fill_validation due to `gui_readonly`.
1302                - **type [str]:** Type of the column, will return Python types.
1303                - **unique [str]:** If this column has an unique restriction.
1304                - **in [str]:** If column type is options, this key will
1305                    indicates the accepted values for this field. This element
1306                    is a dictonary with keys:
1307                    - **description:** Human readble value for option.
1308                    - **description__verbose:** Human readble value for
1309                        option translated by Pumpwood I8s.
1310                    - **value:** Value of the option that will be saved on
1311                        database, for save end-points use this value to
1312                        modify the object.
1313        """
1314        list_fields = self.get_list_fields()
1315        fields_options = self.cls_fields_options()
1316        return Response({
1317            "default_list_fields": list_fields,
1318            "field_descriptions": fields_options})
1319
1320    def retrieve_view_options(self, request) -> dict:
1321        """
1322        Return information to correctly create retrieve view.
1323
1324        Field set are set using gui_retrieve_fieldset attribute of the
1325        class. It is used classes to define each fieldset.
1326
1327        ###### Request payload data:
1328        No payload data.
1329
1330        ###### Request query data:
1331        No query parameters.
1332
1333        Args:
1334            request: Django request.
1335        Returns:
1336            Return a dictonary with information to render retrieve
1337            views on front-ends. Returns a dictonary with keys:
1338            - **fieldset [List[dict]]:** A list of dictionaries with
1339                information for rendering the retrieve page on frontend.
1340                - **fields [List[str]]:** List of fields to be rendered at
1341                    fieldset.
1342                - **name [str]:** Name of the fieldset.
1343                - **name__verbose [str]:** Name of the fieldset translated
1344                    using Pumpwood I8s.
1345            - **verbose_field [str]:** String that can be used to create
1346                user readble string at frontend.
1347
1348            Example:
1349            ```python
1350            {'fieldset': [{
1351                'fields': [
1352                    'status', 'alias', 'description', 'notes', 'dimensions',
1353                    'updated_by', 'updated_at'],
1354                'name__verbose': 'main'
1355                'name': 'main'},
1356              {
1357                'fields': [
1358                    'metabase_id', 'auto_embedding',
1359                    'object_model_class', 'object_pk'],
1360                'name__verbose': 'embedding'
1361                'name': 'embedding'},
1362              {
1363                'fields': [
1364                    'expire_in_min', 'default_theme', 'default_is_bordered',
1365                    'default_is_titled'],
1366                'name__verbose': 'config'
1367                'name': 'config'},
1368              {
1369                'fields': ['extra_info'],
1370                'name__verbose': 'extra_info'
1371                'name': 'extra_info'
1372              }],
1373             'verbose_field': '{pk} | {description}'}
1374            ```
1375        """
1376        gui_retrieve_fieldset = self.get_gui_retrieve_fieldset()
1377        gui_verbose_field = self.get_gui_verbose_field()
1378
1379        # If gui_retrieve_fieldset is not set return all columns
1380        # on the main tab
1381        if gui_retrieve_fieldset is None:
1382            fields_options = self.cls_fields_options()
1383            all_columns = set(fields_options.keys())
1384            all_columns = list(all_columns - {'pk', 'model_class'})
1385            all_columns.sort()
1386            return Response({
1387                "verbose_field": gui_verbose_field,
1388                "fieldset": {None: {"fields": all_columns}}})
1389        else:
1390            return_gui_retrieve_fieldset = copy.deepcopy(gui_retrieve_fieldset)
1391            model_class = self.service_model.__name__
1392            tag_template = "{model_class}__fieldset_name__{fieldset_name}"
1393            for fieldset in return_gui_retrieve_fieldset:
1394                fieldset_name = fieldset["name"]
1395                tag = tag_template.format(
1396                    model_class=model_class, fieldset_name=fieldset_name)
1397                name__verbose = _.t(sentence=fieldset_name, tag=tag)
1398                fieldset["name__verbose"] = name__verbose
1399            return Response({
1400                "verbose_field": gui_verbose_field,
1401                "fieldset": return_gui_retrieve_fieldset})
1402
1403    def fill_options_validation(self, request) -> dict:
1404        """
1405        Return fill options for retrieve/save pages.
1406
1407        It will validate partial data fill return update fill options and
1408        raise validation errors if necessary.
1409
1410        ###### Request payload data:
1411        Partially filled data to be validated by the backend.
1412
1413        ###### Request query data:
1414        - **user_type[str]:**
1415            Must be in ['api', 'gui']. It will return the options according
1416            to interface user is using. When requesting using 'gui',
1417            self.gui_readonly field will be setted as read-only.
1418        - **field [str]:**
1419            Set to validade an specific field. If not set all
1420            fields will be validated. Validation must be implemented.
1421        Args:
1422            request: Django request.
1423        Return [dict]:
1424            Return an dictonary with `field_descriptions` generated by
1425            `cls_fields_options` and `gui_readonly` indicating the fields
1426            that will be set as read-only if user_type='gui'
1427        """
1428        user_type: str = request.query_params.get('user_type', 'api')
1429        field: str = request.query_params.get('field', 'field')
1430        partial_data: dict = request.data
1431
1432        gui_readonly = self.get_gui_readonly()
1433        fill_options = self.cls_fields_options()
1434
1435        # If it is gui interface then set gui_readonly as read-only
1436        # this will limit fields that are not read-only but should not
1437        # be edited be the user
1438        if user_type == 'gui':
1439            for key, item in fill_options.items():
1440                if key in gui_readonly:
1441                    item["read_only"] = True
1442        return Response({
1443            "field_descriptions": fill_options,
1444            "gui_readonly": gui_readonly})

1446
1447class PumpWoodDataBaseRestService(PumpWoodRestService):
1448    """
1449    This view extends PumpWoodRestService, including pivot function.
1450
1451    This view will make data end-points avaiable at frontend for retriving
1452    data without the use of serializers using pivot end-point and bulk
1453    save of data using bulk-save end-point.
1454    """
1455
1456    _view_type = "data"
1457
1458    model_variables = []
1459    """Specify which model variables will be returned in pivot. Line index are
1460       the model_variables - columns (function pivot parameter) itens."""
1461    expected_cols_bulk_save = []
1462    """Set the collumns needed at bulk_save."""
1463
1464    def pivot(self, request) -> Union[list, dict]:
1465        """
1466        Pivot QuerySet data acording to columns selected, and filters passed.
1467
1468        ###### Request payload data:
1469        `filter_dict`, `exclude_dict` and `order_by` parameters have same
1470        behaviour as list end-point.
1471
1472        - **columns [List[str]]:**
1473            List of variables that will be considered as collumns to pivot
1474            data.
1475        - **format [{‘dict’, ‘list’, ‘series’, ‘split’, ‘tight’, ‘records’,
1476            ‘index’}]:** Format paramter to convert pandas DataFrame to
1477            dictonary. This dictonary will be returned by the function.
1478        - **variables [List[str]]:** Variables to be returned, this will
1479            modify default behaviour of returning `model_variables` attribute
1480            fields.
1481        - **show_deleted [bool]:** If model has deleted field, results
1482            flaged as deleted won't be fetched. Setting show_deleted = True
1483            will return this filtered results.
1484        - **add_pk_column [bool]:** If True, pk columns will be added to
1485            results. Using pk columns will not permit to pivot information
1486            (makes no sense). So far only `id` column will be added to results
1487            treating composite pks is on the roadmap.
1488        - **limit [int]:** Limit of the query results (number of objects that
1489            will be returned).
1490
1491        ###### Request query data:
1492        No query parameters.
1493
1494        Returns:
1495            Return a pandas DataFrame serialized according to format
1496            parameter.
1497        Raises:
1498            PumpWoodForbidden:
1499                'Pivot is not avaiable, set model_variables at view'. Indicates
1500                that this end-point is not avaiable. To habilitate it, it is
1501                necessary to set `model_variables` attribute at view.
1502            PumpWoodQueryException:
1503                'Columns must be a list of elements.'. Indicates that columns
1504                type is not a list of strings.
1505            PumpWoodQueryException:
1506                'Column chosen as pivot is not at model variables'. Indicates
1507                that column is not present on `model_variables` attribute.
1508            PumpWoodQueryException:
1509                Propagate errors raised when executing the query.
1510            PumpWoodQueryException:
1511                'value column not at melted data, it is not possible
1512                 to pivot dataframe.'. Indicates that value column is not
1513                 avaiable query results, so it not possible to pivot data.
1514        """
1515        if self.model_variables is None:
1516            msg = "Pivot is not avaiable, set model_variables at view"
1517            raise exceptions.PumpWoodForbidden(msg)
1518
1519        columns = request.data.get('columns', [])
1520        format = request.data.get('format', 'list')
1521        model_variables = (
1522            request.data.get('variables') or self.model_variables)
1523        show_deleted = request.data.get('show_deleted', False)
1524        add_pk_column = request.data.get('add_pk_column', False)
1525        limit = request.data.get('limit', None)
1526
1527        if type(columns) is not list:
1528            raise exceptions.PumpWoodQueryException(
1529                'Columns must be a list of elements.')
1530        if len(set(columns) - set(model_variables)) != 0:
1531            raise exceptions.PumpWoodQueryException(
1532                'Column chosen as pivot is not at model variables')
1533
1534        index = list(set(model_variables) - set(columns))
1535        filter_dict = request.data.get('filter_dict', {})
1536        exclude_dict = request.data.get('exclude_dict', {})
1537        order_by = request.data.get('order_by', {})
1538
1539        if hasattr(self.service_model, 'deleted'):
1540            if not show_deleted:
1541                filter_dict["deleted"] = False
1542
1543        #############################
1544        # Add id columns to results #
1545        # TODO: Add other fields if set as composite primary key.
1546        if add_pk_column:
1547            if len(columns) != 0:
1548                raise exceptions.PumpWoodException(
1549                    "Can not add pk column and pivot information")
1550            model_variables = ['id'] + model_variables
1551
1552        # Limit pivot results if limit parameter is set
1553        query_set = self.service_model.objects.all()
1554        if limit is not None:
1555            query_set = query_set[:int(limit)]
1556
1557        arg_dict = {
1558            'query_set': query_set,
1559            'filter_dict': filter_dict, 'exclude_dict': exclude_dict,
1560            'order_by': order_by}
1561        query_set = filter_by_dict(**arg_dict)
1562
1563        try:
1564            filtered_objects_as_list = list(
1565                query_set.values_list(*(model_variables)))
1566        except TypeError as e:
1567            raise exceptions.PumpWoodQueryException(message=str(e))
1568
1569        melted_data = pd.DataFrame(
1570            filtered_objects_as_list, columns=model_variables)
1571
1572        if len(columns) == 0:
1573            return Response(melted_data.to_dict(format))
1574
1575        if melted_data.shape[0] == 0:
1576            return Response({})
1577        else:
1578            if "value" not in melted_data.columns:
1579                raise exceptions.PumpWoodQueryException(
1580                    "'value' column not at melted data, it is not possible"
1581                    " to pivot dataframe.")
1582
1583            pivoted_table = pd.pivot_table(
1584                melted_data, values='value', index=index,
1585                columns=columns, aggfunc=lambda x: tuple(x)[0])
1586
1587            return Response(
1588                pivoted_table.reset_index().to_dict(format))
1589
1590    def bulk_save(self, request) -> dict:
1591        r"""
1592        Bulk save data.
1593
1594        This end-point is prefereble for large datainputs on Pumpwood, it is
1595        not possible to update entries, just add new ones.
1596
1597        It is much more performant than adding one by one using save
1598        end-point.
1599
1600        ###### Request payload data:
1601        List of dictionaries which must have self.expected_cols_bulk_save.
1602
1603        ###### Request query data:
1604        No query parameters.
1605
1606        Args:
1607            request: Django request.
1608        Returns:
1609            A dictonary with key `saved_count` indicating the number of
1610            objects that were add to database.
1611        Raises:
1612            PumpWoodForbidden:
1613                'Bulk save not avaiable. Set expected_cols_bulk_save on
1614                PumpWoodDataBaseRestService View to habilitate funciton.'
1615                Indicates that bulk_save end-point was not configured
1616                for this model class. It is necessary to set
1617                `expected_cols_bulk_save` attribute to make end-point
1618                avaiable.
1619            PumpWoodObjectSavingException:
1620                'Post payload is a list of objects.'. Indicates that the
1621                request payload is not a list as expected.
1622            PumpWoodObjectSavingException:
1623                'Expected columns and data columns do not match:
1624                \nExpected columns:{expected}
1625                \nData columns:{data_cols}'. Indicates that the fields passed
1626                on the objects are diferent from the expected by the end-point
1627                check the data or the configuration of the end-point.
1628        """
1629        if len(self.expected_cols_bulk_save) == 0:
1630            msg = (
1631                "Bulk save not avaiable. Set expected_cols_bulk_save on "
1632                "PumpWoodDataBaseRestService View to habilitate funciton.")
1633            raise exceptions.PumpWoodForbidden(msg)
1634
1635        data_to_save = request.data
1636        if type(data_to_save) is not list:
1637            raise exceptions.PumpWoodObjectSavingException(
1638                'Post payload is a list of objects.')
1639
1640        pd_data_to_save = pd.DataFrame(data_to_save)
1641        pd_data_cols = set(list(pd_data_to_save.columns))
1642
1643        if len(set(self.expected_cols_bulk_save) - pd_data_cols) == 0:
1644            objects_to_load = []
1645            for d in data_to_save:
1646                new_obj = self.service_model(**d)
1647                objects_to_load.append(new_obj)
1648
1649            self.service_model.objects.bulk_create(objects_to_load)
1650            return Response({'saved_count': len(objects_to_load)})
1651        else:
1652            msg = (
1653                'Expected columns and data columns do not match:' +
1654                '\nExpected columns:{expected}' +
1655                '\nData columns:{data_cols}')
1656            raise exceptions.PumpWoodObjectSavingException(
1657                    message=msg,
1658                    payload={
1659                        "expected": list(self.expected_cols_bulk_save),
1660                        "data_cols": pd_data_cols})
def save_serializer_instance(serializer_instance): 
34def save_serializer_instance(serializer_instance):
35    """
36    Save instant using serializer and raise if any validation error.
37
38    Is is not valid acording to serializer validation, raise error.
39
40    Args:
41        serializer_instance:
42            Serializer with an object to be saved.
43    Returns:
44        New object updated or created.
45    Raises:
46        PumpWoodObjectSavingException:
47            'Error when validating fields when saving object'. Raise error if
48            validation of serializer is not correct. It will return error
49            dictonary at error payload.
50    """
51    is_valid = serializer_instance.is_valid()
52    if is_valid:
53        return serializer_instance.save()
54    else:
55        raise exceptions.PumpWoodObjectSavingException(
56            message="Error when validating fields when saving object",
57            payload=serializer_instance.errors)

class PumpWoodRestService(rest_framework.viewsets.ViewSet): 
  60class PumpWoodRestService(viewsets.ViewSet):
  61    """
  62    Basic View-Set for pumpwood rest end-points.
  63
  64    Example:
  65    ```python
  66    from metabase.models import MetabaseDashboard
  67    from metabase.serializers import MetabaseDashboardSerializer
  68    from config import storage_object, microservice
  69
  70
  71    class RestMetabaseDashboard(PumpWoodRestService):
  72        endpoint_description = "Metabase Dashboard"
  73        notes = "Register and generate url to embed Metabase dashboards"
  74
  75        # Django model that will be mapped to this end-point
  76        service_model = MetabaseDashboard
  77
  78        # Serializer that will be used to dump model data
  79        serializer = MetabaseDashboardSerializer
  80
  81        # PumpwoodStorage object that will be used to save and retrieve
  82        # file data from storage.
  83        storage_object = storage_object
  84
  85        # PumpWoodMicroService object used to communicate with other
  86        # microservice if necessary. Ex: Trigger ETL Jobs on object
  87        # saving and update.
  88        microservice = microservice
  89
  90        # Fields that will be considered as files and extensions that
  91        # will be accepted.
  92        file_fields = {
  93            'file': ['json', 'xlsx']
  94        }
  95
  96        ###########################################################
  97        # Gui this information will be returned at retrieve_options
  98        # to help frontend correctly render app frontend.
  99        # Set field sets, grouping the fields and hiding those that
 100        # ar not listed on fieldsets
 101        gui_retrieve_fieldset = [{
 102                "name": "main",
 103                "fields": [
 104                    "status", "alias", "description", "notes",
 105                    "dimensions", "updated_by", "updated_at"]
 106            }, {
 107                "name": "embedding",
 108                "fields": [
 109                    "metabase_id", "auto_embedding", "object_model_class",
 110                    "object_pk"]
 111            }, {
 112                "name": "config",
 113                "fields": [
 114                    "expire_in_min", "default_theme",
 115                    "default_is_bordered", "default_is_titled"]
 116            }, {
 117                "name": "extra_info",
 118                "fields": ["extra_info"]
 119            }

 121

 123        # is called with query parameter `?user_type=gui`
 124        gui_readonly = ["updated_by_id", "updated_at", "extra_info"]
 125

 127        gui_verbose_field = '{pk} | {description}'
 128    ```
 129    """

 132    renderer_classes = [PumpwoodJSONRenderer]

 156       saving and update."""
 157    trigger: bool = False
 158    """If should be called ELTTrigger at ETL microservice at saving, deleting
 159       and executing actions. Default value is False."""

 165    """File fields associated with model, it is a dictonary with keys as

 170    list_paginate_limit: int = 50

 269    @staticmethod
 270    def _allowed_extension(filename, allowed_extensions):
 271        extension = 'none'
 272        if '.' in filename:
 273            extension = filename.rsplit('.', 1)[1].lower()
 274
 275        if "*" not in allowed_extensions:
 276            if extension not in allowed_extensions:
 277                return [(
 278                    "File {filename} with extension {extension} not " +
 279                    "allowed.\n Allowed extensions: {allowed_extensions}"
 280                ).format(filename=filename, extension=extension,
 281                         allowed_extensions=str(allowed_extensions))]
 282        return []
