def save(self, request) -> dict: 
685    def save(self, request) -> dict:
686        """
687        Save and update object acording to request.data.
688
689        Object will be updated if request.data['pk'] is not None.
690
691        ###### Request payload data:
692        Object to be saved. If a pk is set them the object will be updated,
693        if pk is None or not set a new object will be created.
694
695        ###### Request query data:
696        No query parameters.
697
698        Args:
699            request: Django request.
700        Returns:
701            Serialized new/updated object.
702
703        Raises:
704            PumpWoodException:
705                'Object model class diferent from {service_model} :
706                {service_model}'. Indicates that the end-point and the
707                model_class of the object are impatible.
708            PumpWoodObjectSavingException:
709                'Error when validating fields when saving object'. Indicates
710                that there were error when validating object
711                at the serializer. Error payload will have the fields with
712                error as keys of the dictonary.
713        """
714        request_data: dict = None
715        if "application/json" in request.content_type.lower():
716            request_data = request.data
717        else:
718            request_data = request.data.dict()
719            json_data = json.loads(request_data.pop("__json__", '{}'))
720            request_data.update(json_data)
721
722        data_pk = request_data.get('pk')
723        saved_obj = None
724        for field in self.file_fields.keys():
725            request_data.pop(field, None)
726
727        # update
728        if data_pk:
729            data_to_update = self.service_model.objects.get(pk=data_pk)
730            serializer = self.serializer(
731                data_to_update, data=request_data,
732                context={'request': request})
733            saved_obj = save_serializer_instance(serializer)
734            response_status = status.HTTP_200_OK
735        # save
736        else:
737            serializer = self.serializer(
738                data=request_data, context={'request': request})
739            saved_obj = save_serializer_instance(serializer)
740            response_status = status.HTTP_201_CREATED
741
742        # Uploading files
743        object_errors = {}
744        file_save_time = datetime.datetime.utcnow().strftime(
745            "%Y-%m-%dT%Hh%Mm%Ss")
746        for field in self.file_fields.keys():
747            field_errors = []
748            if field in request.FILES:
749                file = request.FILES[field]
750
751                file_name = secure_filename(file.name)
752                field_errors.extend(self._allowed_extension(
753                    filename=file_name,
754                    allowed_extensions=self.file_fields[field]))
755
756                filename = "{}___{}___{}".format(
757                    str(saved_obj.id).zfill(15),
758                    file_save_time,
759                    file_name)
760                if len(field_errors) != 0:
761                    object_errors[field] = field_errors
762                else:
763                    model_class = self.service_model.__name__.lower()
764                    file_path = '{model_class}__{field}/'.format(
765                        model_class=model_class, field=field)
766                    storage_filepath = self.storage_object.write_file(
767                        file_path=file_path, file_name=filename,
768                        data=file.read(),
769                        content_type=file.content_type,
770                        if_exists='overide')
771                    setattr(saved_obj, field, storage_filepath)
772
773        if object_errors != {}:
774            message = "error when saving object: " \
775                if data_pk is None else "error when updating object: "
776            payload = object_errors
777            message_to_append = []
778            for key, value in object_errors.items():
779                message_to_append.append(key + ", " + str(value))
780            message = message + "; ".join(message_to_append)
781            raise exceptions.PumpWoodObjectSavingException(
782                message=message, payload=payload)
783        saved_obj.save()
784
785        if self.microservice is not None and self.trigger:
786            # Process ETLTrigger for the model class
787            self.microservice.login()
788            if data_pk is None:
789                self.microservice.execute_action(
790                    "ETLTrigger", action="process_triggers", parameters={
791                        "model_class": self.service_model.__name__.lower(),
792                        "type": "create",
793                        "pk": None,
794                        "action_name": None})
795            else:
796                self.microservice.execute_action(
797                    "ETLTrigger", action="process_triggers", parameters={
798                        "model_class": self.service_model.__name__.lower(),
799                        "type": "update",
800                        "pk": saved_obj.pk,
801                        "action_name": None})
802
803        # Overhead, serializando e deserializando o objecto
804        return Response(
805            self.serializer(saved_obj).data, status=response_status)

Save and update object acording to request.data.

Object will be updated if request.data['pk'] is not None.

Request payload data:

Object to be saved. If a pk is set them the object will be updated, if pk is None or not set a new object will be created.

Request query data:

No query parameters.

Arguments:
  • request: Django request.
Returns:

Serialized new/updated object.

Raises:
  • PumpWoodException: 'Object model class diferent from {service_model} : {service_model}'. Indicates that the end-point and the model_class of the object are impatible.
  • PumpWoodObjectSavingException: 'Error when validating fields when saving object'. Indicates that there were error when validating object at the serializer. Error payload will have the fields with error as keys of the dictonary.
def list_actions(self, request) -> List[dict]: 
825    def list_actions(self, request) -> List[dict]:
826        """
827        List model exposed actions.
828
829        ###### Request payload data:
830        No payload.
831
832        ###### Request query data:
833        No query parameters.
834
835        Args:
836            request: Django request.
837        Returns:
838            Return a list of dictonary with information of the avaiable
839            actions for model class. Actions info object keys:
840            - **action_name [str]:** Name of the function associated with
841                action on model_class.
842            - **action_name__verbose [str]:** Name of the function associated
843                with action on model_class translates by Pumpwood I8s.
844            - **doc_string [str]:** Doc string associated with function.
845            - **info [str]:** Info for que action passed as argument at action
846                function decorator.
847            - **info__verbose [str]:** Info for que action passed as argument
848                at action function decorator model_class translates by
849                Pumpwood I8s.
850            - **is_static_function [bool]:** Boolean value setting if function
851                is classmethod or staticmethod (True), in this cases it is not
852                associated with an object and aa pk should no be passed as
853                argument.
854            - **parameters [dict]:** Dictionary with paramenter as key and with
855                keys:
856                - **default_value [any]:** Default value for paramenter.
857                - **many [bool]:** If the function parameter is many (list).
858                - **required [bool]:** If the parameter is necessary to run the
859                    function or optinal.
860                - **type [str]:** Type of the paramenter that shoul be passed
861                    to function.
862                - **verbose_name [str]:** Parameter name translated using
863                    Pumpwood I8s.
864            - **return [dict]:** A dictionary with the type associated with
865                function return. Keys:
866                - **many [bool]:** If the return result is a list.
867                - **type [str]:** Type of the return.
868        """
869        actions = self._get_actions()
870        action_descriptions = []
871        translation_tag_template = "{model_class}__action__{action}"
872        model_class = self.service_model.__name__
873        for name, action in actions.items():
874            action_dict = action.action_object.to_dict()
875            tag = translation_tag_template.format(
876                model_class=model_class,
877                action=action_dict["action_name"])
878
879            #########################################################
880            # Translate action_name and info to end-user at verbose #
881            action_dict["action_name__verbose"] = _.t(
882                sentence=action_dict["action_name"], tag=tag + "__action_name")
883            action_dict["info__verbose"] = _.t(
884                sentence=action_dict["info"], tag=tag + "__info")
885            for key, item in action_dict["parameters"].items():
886                item["verbose_name"] = _.t(
887                    sentence=key, tag=tag + "__parameters")
888            #########################################################
889            action_descriptions.append(action_dict)
890
891        return Response(action_descriptions)

def execute_action(self, request, action_name, pk=None) -> dict: 
 893    def execute_action(self, request, action_name, pk=None) -> dict:
 894        """
 895        Execute action over object or class using parameters.
 896
 897        ###### Request payload data:
 898        Payload dictionary correspont to function parameters as key->value
 899        elements.
 900
 901        ###### Request query data:
 902        No query parameters.
 903
 904        Args:
 905            request:
 906                Django request.
 907            action_name [str]:
 908                Action name.
 909            pk [pk]:
 910                Of the object that will be used to run the action. For
 911                staticmethods and classmethods the object should not be
 912                passed as argument.
 913        Returns:
 914            Return a dictonary with keys:
 915            -
 916        Raises:
 917            PumpWoodActionArgsException:
 918                'Action [{action}] at model [{class_name}] is not
 919                a classmethod and not pk provided.'. Indicates that the action
 920                is not a classmethod and the pk was not passed as function
 921                argument.
 922            PumpWoodActionArgsException:
 923                'Action [{action}] at model [{class_name}] is a
 924                classmethod and pk provided.'. Indicates that the action is
 925                a classmethod, but a pk was passed as argument.
 926            PumpWoodObjectDoesNotExist:
 927                'Requested object {service_model}[{pk}] not found.'.
 928                Indicates that the object with [pk] was not found on
 929                database.
 930            PumpWoodActionArgsException:
 931                'error when unserializing function arguments: [...]'.
 932                Indicates that it was not possible to unserialize objects
 933                passed as function arguments. Pumpwood used function tips
 934                types to convert the arguments on correct types before
 935                passing them to function.
 936        """
 937        parameters = request.data
 938        actions = self._get_actions()
 939        rest_action_names = list(actions.keys())
 940
 941        if action_name not in rest_action_names:
 942            message = (
 943                "There is no method {action} in rest actions "
 944                "for {class_name}").format(
 945                    action=action_name,
 946                    class_name=self.service_model.__name__)
 947            raise exceptions.PumpWoodForbidden(
 948                message=message, payload={"action_name": action_name})
 949
 950        action = getattr(self.service_model, action_name)
 951        if pk is None and not action.action_object.is_static_function:
 952            msg_template = (
 953                "Action [{action}] at model [{class_name}] is not "
 954                "a classmethod and not pk provided.")
 955            message = msg_template.format(
 956                action=action_name,
 957                class_name=self.service_model.__name__)
 958            raise exceptions.PumpWoodActionArgsException(
 959                message=message, payload={"action_name": action_name})
 960
 961        if pk is not None and action.action_object.is_static_function:
 962            msg_template = (
 963                "Action [{action}] at model [{class_name}] is a"
 964                "classmethod and pk provided.")
 965            message = msg_template.format(
 966                action=action_name,
 967                class_name=self.service_model.__name__)
 968            raise exceptions.PumpWoodActionArgsException(
 969                message=message, payload={"action_name": action_name})
 970
 971        object_dict = None
 972        action = None
 973        if pk is not None:
 974            model_object = self.service_model.objects.filter(pk=pk).first()
 975            if model_object is None:
 976                message_template = (
 977                    "Requested object {service_model}[{pk}] not found.")
 978                temp_service_model = \
 979                    self.service_model.__name__
 980                message = message_template.format(
 981                    service_model=temp_service_model, pk=pk)
 982                raise exceptions.PumpWoodObjectDoesNotExist(
 983                    message=message, payload={
 984                        "service_model": temp_service_model, "pk": pk})
 985
 986            action = getattr(model_object, action_name)
 987            object_dict = self.serializer(model_object, many=False).data
 988        else:
 989            action = getattr(self.service_model, action_name)
 990
 991        loaded_parameters = load_action_parameters(action, parameters, request)
 992        result = action(**loaded_parameters)
 993
 994        if self.microservice is not None and self.trigger:
 995            self.microservice.login()
 996            self.microservice.execute_action(
 997                "ETLTrigger", action="process_triggers", parameters={
 998                    "model_class": self.service_model.__name__.lower(),
 999                    "type": "action", "pk": pk, "action_name": action_name})
1000
1001        return Response({
1002            'result': result, 'action': action_name,
1003            'parameters': parameters, 'object': object_dict})

def cls_fields_options(cls) -> dict: 
1005    @classmethod
1006    def cls_fields_options(cls) -> dict:
1007        """
1008        Return field options using serializer.
1009
1010        Args:
1011            No args.
1012        Returns:
1013            Return information for each column to render search filters on
1014            frontend. Each field will have:
1015            - **column [str]:** Name of the column associated with the
1016                field (same as the key).
1017            - **column__verbose [str]:** Name of the collumns translated
1018                using Pumpwood I8s.
1019            - **default [str]:** Defult value for column.
1020            - **extra_info [str]:** Extra information for the collumns
1021                can be used to pass information about foreign key or
1022                related fields.
1023            - **help_text [str]:** Help text associated with the collumn.
1024            - **help_text__verbose [str]:** Help text associated with the
1025                collumn translated using Pumpwood I8s.
1026            - **indexed [str]:** If this column is indexed.
1027            - **nullable [str]:** If this column is nullable.
1028            - **primary_key [str]:** If this column is part of the primary
1029                key of the table. This is use full for tables with
1030                composite pk.
1031            - **read_only [str]:** If this column is read-only on
1032                end-point. The results for this value may differ from
1033                fill_validation due to `gui_readonly`.
1034            - **type [str]:** Type of the column, will return Python types.
1035            - **unique [str]:** If this column has an unique restriction.
1036            - **in [str]:** If column type is options, this key will
1037                indicates the accepted values for this field. This element
1038                is a dictonary with keys:
1039                - **description:** Human readble value for option.
1040                - **description__verbose:** Human readble value for
1041                    option translated by Pumpwood I8s.
1042                - **value:** Value of the option that will be saved on
1043                    database, for save end-points use this value to
1044                    modify the object.
1045        """
1046        fields = cls.service_model._meta.get_fields()
1047        dict_fields = {}
1048        for f in fields:
1049            is_relation = getattr(f, "is_relation", False)
1050            primary_key = getattr(f, "primary_key", False)
1051            if not is_relation or primary_key:
1052                dict_fields[f.column] = f
1053
1054        model_class = cls.service_model.__name__
1055        translation_tag_template = "{model_class}__fields__{field}"
1056
1057        # Get read-only fields from serializer
1058        read_only_fields = getattr(cls.serializer.Meta, "read_only_fields", [])
1059
1060        # Get field serializers
1061        serializer_fields = cls.serializer(
1062            foreign_key_fields=True, related_fields=True).fields
1063
1064        # Get serializers associated with FKs and related models
1065        microservice_fk_dict = {}
1066        microservice_related_dict = {}
1067
1068        all_info = {}
1069        for field_name, field_serializer in serializer_fields.items():
1070            ################################################################
1071            # Do not create relations between models in search description #
1072            is_microservice_fk = isinstance(
1073                field_serializer, MicroserviceForeignKeyField)
1074            is_local_fk = isinstance(
1075                field_serializer, LocalForeignKeyField)
1076            if is_microservice_fk or is_local_fk:
1077                field_key = field_serializer.get_fields_options_key()
1078                microservice_fk_dict[field_key] = field_serializer
1079
1080            is_microservice_related = isinstance(
1081                field_serializer, MicroserviceRelatedField)
1082            is_local_related = isinstance(
1083                field_serializer, LocalRelatedField)
1084            if is_microservice_related or is_local_related:
1085                field_key = field_serializer.get_fields_options_key()
1086                microservice_related_dict[field_key] = field_serializer
1087
1088            f = dict_fields.get(field_serializer.source)
1089            if f is None:
1090                continue
1091            ################################################################
1092
1093            column_info = {}
1094
1095            # Getting correspondent simple type
1096            column_type = f.get_internal_type()
1097            python_type = django_map.get(column_type)
1098            if python_type is None:
1099                msg = (
1100                    "Type [{column_type}] not implemented in map dictionary "
1101                    "django type -> python type")
1102                raise NotImplementedError(
1103                    msg.format(column_type=column_type))
1104
1105            # Getting default value
1106            default = None
1107            f_default = getattr(f, 'default', None)
1108            if f_default != NOT_PROVIDED and f_default is not None:
1109                if callable(f_default):
1110                    default = f_default()
1111                else:
1112                    default = f_default
1113
1114            primary_key = getattr(f, "primary_key", False)
1115            help_text = str(getattr(f, "help_text", ""))
1116            db_index = getattr(f, "db_index", False)
1117            unique = getattr(f, "unique", False)
1118
1119            column = None
1120            if primary_key:
1121                column = "pk"
1122            else:
1123                column = f.column
1124
1125            tag = translation_tag_template.format(
1126                model_class=model_class, field=column)
1127            column__verbose = _.t(
1128                sentence=column, tag=tag + "__column")
1129            help_text__verbose = _.t(
1130                sentence=help_text, tag=tag + "__help_text")
1131            column_info = {
1132                'primary_key': primary_key,
1133                "column": column,
1134                "column__verbose": column__verbose,
1135                "help_text": help_text,
1136                "help_text__verbose": help_text__verbose,
1137                "type": python_type,
1138                "nullable": f.null,
1139                "default": default,
1140                "indexed": db_index or primary_key,
1141                "unique": unique,
1142                "read_only": (
1143                    (column in read_only_fields) or
1144                    (field_name == 'pk')
1145                ), "extra_info": {}}
1146
1147            # Get choice options if avaiable
1148            choices = getattr(f, "choices", None)
1149            if choices is not None:
1150                column_info["type"] = "options"
1151                in_list = {}
1152                for choice in choices:
1153                    description = _.t(
1154                        sentence=choice[1], tag=tag + "__choices")
1155                    in_list[choice[0]] = {
1156                        "description": choice[1],
1157                        "description__verbose": description,
1158                        "value": choice[0]}
1159                column_info["in"] = in_list
1160
1161            # Set autoincrement for primary keys
1162            if primary_key:
1163                column_info["column"] = "pk"
1164                column_info["default"] = "#autoincrement#"
1165                column_info["doc_string"] = "object primary key"
1166
1167            # Ajust type if file
1168            file_field = cls.file_fields.get(column)
1169            if file_field is not None:
1170                column_info["type"] = "file"
1171                column_info["extra_info"] = {
1172                    "permited_file_types": file_field}
1173            all_info[column] = column_info
1174
1175        #############################################
1176        # Adding field description for foreign keys #
1177        for key, item in microservice_fk_dict.items():
1178            column = getattr(cls.service_model, key, None)
1179            if column is None:
1180                msg = (
1181                    "Foreign Key [{key}] was not found as model_class "
1182                    "[{model_class}] fields")
1183                raise exceptions.PumpWoodOtherException(
1184                    message=msg,
1185                    payload={"key": key, "model_class": model_class})
1186
1187            tag = translation_tag_template.format(
1188                model_class=model_class, field=key)
1189
1190            primary_key = getattr(column.field, "primary_key", False)
1191            help_text = str(getattr(column.field, "help_text", ""))
1192            db_index = getattr(column.field, "db_index", False)
1193            unique = getattr(column.field, "unique", False)
1194            null = getattr(column.field, "null", False)
1195
1196            # Getting default value
1197            default = None
1198            f_default = getattr(f, 'default', None)
1199            if f_default != NOT_PROVIDED and f_default is not None:
1200                if callable(f_default):
1201                    default = f_default()
1202                else:
1203                    default = f_default
1204
1205            column__verbose = _.t(
1206                sentence=key, tag=tag + "__column")
1207            help_text__verbose = _.t(
1208                sentence=help_text, tag=tag + "__help_text")
1209            column_info = {
1210                'primary_key': primary_key,
1211                "column": key,
1212                'column__verbose': column__verbose,
1213                "help_text": help_text,
1214                'help_text__verbose': help_text__verbose,
1215                "type": "foreign_key",
1216                "nullable": null,
1217                "default": default,
1218                "indexed": db_index or primary_key,
1219                "unique": unique,
1220                "read_only": key in read_only_fields,
1221                "extra_info": item.to_dict()}
1222            all_info[key] = column_info
1223
1224        #############################################
1225        # Adding field description for foreign keys #
1226        for key, item in microservice_related_dict.items():
1227            tag = translation_tag_template.format(
1228                model_class=model_class, field=key)
1229
1230            column__verbose = _.t(
1231                sentence=key, tag=tag + "__column")
1232            help_text__verbose = _.t(
1233                sentence=help_text, tag=tag + "__help_text")
1234            column_info = {
1235                'primary_key': False,
1236                "column": key,
1237                'column__verbose': column__verbose,
1238                "help_text": help_text,
1239                'help_text__verbose': help_text__verbose,
1240                "type": "related_model",
1241                "nullable": True,
1242                "default": default,
1243                "indexed": False,
1244                "unique": False,
1245                "read_only": False,
1246                "extra_info": item.to_dict()}
1247            all_info[key] = column_info
1248        return all_info

def list_view_options(self, request) -> dict: 
1266    def list_view_options(self, request) -> dict:
1267        """
1268        Return information to render list views on frontend.
1269
1270        ###### Request payload data:
1271        No payload data.
1272
1273        ###### Request query data:
1274        No query parameters.
1275
1276        Args:

1278        Returns:
1279            Return a dictionary with keys:
1280            - **list_fields[List[str]]:** Return a list of default list fields
1281                that should be redendered on list view.
1282            - **field_type [dict]:** Return information for each column to
1283                render search filters on frontend. Each field will have:
1284                - **column [str]:** Name of the column associated with the
1285                    field (same as the key).
1286                - **column__verbose [str]:** Name of the collumns translated
1287                    using Pumpwood I8s.
1288                - **default [str]:** Defult value for column.
1289                - **extra_info [str]:** Extra information for the collumns
1290                    can be used to pass information about foreign key or
1291                    related fields.
1292                - **help_text [str]:** Help text associated with the collumn.
1293                - **help_text__verbose [str]:** Help text associated with the
1294                    collumn translated using Pumpwood I8s.
1295                - **indexed [str]:** If this column is indexed.
1296                - **nullable [str]:** If this column is nullable.
1297                - **primary_key [str]:** If this column is part of the primary
1298                    key of the table. This is use full for tables with
1299                    composite pk.
1300                - **read_only [str]:** If this column is read-only on
1301                    end-point. The results for this value may differ from
1302                    fill_validation due to `gui_readonly`.
1303                - **type [str]:** Type of the column, will return Python types.
1304                - **unique [str]:** If this column has an unique restriction.
1305                - **in [str]:** If column type is options, this key will
1306                    indicates the accepted values for this field. This element
1307                    is a dictonary with keys:
1308                    - **description:** Human readble value for option.
1309                    - **description__verbose:** Human readble value for
1310                        option translated by Pumpwood I8s.
1311                    - **value:** Value of the option that will be saved on
1312                        database, for save end-points use this value to
1313                        modify the object.
1314        """
1315        list_fields = self.get_list_fields()
1316        fields_options = self.cls_fields_options()
1317        return Response({
1318            "default_list_fields": list_fields,
1319            "field_descriptions": fields_options})

1373              }],

1375            ```

1379
1380        # If gui_retrieve_fieldset is not set return all columns
1381        # on the main tab
1382        if gui_retrieve_fieldset is None:
1383            fields_options = self.cls_fields_options()
1384            all_columns = set(fields_options.keys())
1385            all_columns = list(all_columns - {'pk', 'model_class'})
1386            all_columns.sort()
1387            return Response({
1388                "verbose_field": gui_verbose_field,
1389                "fieldset": {None: {"fields": all_columns}}})
1390        else:
1391            return_gui_retrieve_fieldset = copy.deepcopy(gui_retrieve_fieldset)
1392            model_class = self.service_model.__name__
1393            tag_template = "{model_class}__fieldset_name__{fieldset_name}"
1394            for fieldset in return_gui_retrieve_fieldset:
1395                fieldset_name = fieldset["name"]
1396                tag = tag_template.format(
1397                    model_class=model_class, fieldset_name=fieldset_name)
1398                name__verbose = _.t(sentence=fieldset_name, tag=tag)
1399                fieldset["name__verbose"] = name__verbose
1400            return Response({
1401                "verbose_field": gui_verbose_field,
1402                "fieldset": return_gui_retrieve_fieldset})

def fill_options_validation(self, request) -> dict: 
1404    def fill_options_validation(self, request) -> dict:
1405        """
1406        Return fill options for retrieve/save pages.
1407
1408        It will validate partial data fill return update fill options and
1409        raise validation errors if necessary.
1410
1411        ###### Request payload data:
1412        Partially filled data to be validated by the backend.
1413
1414        ###### Request query data:
1415        - **user_type[str]:**
1416            Must be in ['api', 'gui']. It will return the options according
1417            to interface user is using. When requesting using 'gui',
1418            self.gui_readonly field will be setted as read-only.
1419        - **field [str]:**
1420            Set to validade an specific field. If not set all
1421            fields will be validated. Validation must be implemented.
1422        Args:
1423            request: Django request.
1424        Return [dict]:
1425            Return an dictonary with `field_descriptions` generated by
1426            `cls_fields_options` and `gui_readonly` indicating the fields
1427            that will be set as read-only if user_type='gui'
1428        """
1429        user_type: str = request.query_params.get('user_type', 'api')
1430        field: str = request.query_params.get('field', 'field')
1431        partial_data: dict = request.data
1432
1433        gui_readonly = self.get_gui_readonly()
1434        fill_options = self.cls_fields_options()
1435
1436        # If it is gui interface then set gui_readonly as read-only
1437        # this will limit fields that are not read-only but should not
1438        # be edited be the user
1439        if user_type == 'gui':
1440            for key, item in fill_options.items():
1441                if key in gui_readonly:
1442                    item["read_only"] = True
1443        return Response({
1444            "field_descriptions": fill_options,
1445            "gui_readonly": gui_readonly})

  • field [str]: Set to validade an specific field. If not set all fields will be validated. Validation must be implemented.

class PumpWoodDataBaseRestService(PumpWoodRestService): 
1448class PumpWoodDataBaseRestService(PumpWoodRestService):
1449    """
1450    This view extends PumpWoodRestService, including pivot function.
1451
1452    This view will make data end-points avaiable at frontend for retriving
1453    data without the use of serializers using pivot end-point and bulk
1454    save of data using bulk-save end-point.
1455    """
1456
1457    _view_type = "data"
1458
1459    model_variables = []
1460    """Specify which model variables will be returned in pivot. Line index are
1461       the model_variables - columns (function pivot parameter) itens."""
1462    expected_cols_bulk_save = []
1463    """Set the collumns needed at bulk_save."""
1464
1465    def pivot(self, request) -> Union[list, dict]:
1466        """
1467        Pivot QuerySet data acording to columns selected, and filters passed.
1468
1469        ###### Request payload data:
1470        `filter_dict`, `exclude_dict` and `order_by` parameters have same
1471        behaviour as list end-point.
1472
1473        - **columns [List[str]]:**
1474            List of variables that will be considered as collumns to pivot
1475            data.
1476        - **format [{‘dict’, ‘list’, ‘series’, ‘split’, ‘tight’, ‘records’,
1477            ‘index’}]:** Format paramter to convert pandas DataFrame to
1478            dictonary. This dictonary will be returned by the function.
1479        - **variables [List[str]]:** Variables to be returned, this will
1480            modify default behaviour of returning `model_variables` attribute
1481            fields.
1482        - **show_deleted [bool]:** If model has deleted field, results
1483            flaged as deleted won't be fetched. Setting show_deleted = True
1484            will return this filtered results.
1485        - **add_pk_column [bool]:** If True, pk columns will be added to
1486            results. Using pk columns will not permit to pivot information
1487            (makes no sense). So far only `id` column will be added to results
1488            treating composite pks is on the roadmap.
1489        - **limit [int]:** Limit of the query results (number of objects that
1490            will be returned).
1491
1492        ###### Request query data:
1493        No query parameters.
1494
1495        Returns:
1496            Return a pandas DataFrame serialized according to format
1497            parameter.
1498        Raises:
1499            PumpWoodForbidden:
1500                'Pivot is not avaiable, set model_variables at view'. Indicates
1501                that this end-point is not avaiable. To habilitate it, it is
1502                necessary to set `model_variables` attribute at view.
1503            PumpWoodQueryException:
1504                'Columns must be a list of elements.'. Indicates that columns
1505                type is not a list of strings.
1506            PumpWoodQueryException:
1507                'Column chosen as pivot is not at model variables'. Indicates
1508                that column is not present on `model_variables` attribute.
1509            PumpWoodQueryException:
1510                Propagate errors raised when executing the query.
1511            PumpWoodQueryException:
1512                'value column not at melted data, it is not possible
1513                 to pivot dataframe.'. Indicates that value column is not
1514                 avaiable query results, so it not possible to pivot data.
1515        """
1516        if self.model_variables is None:
1517            msg = "Pivot is not avaiable, set model_variables at view"
1518            raise exceptions.PumpWoodForbidden(msg)
1519
1520        columns = request.data.get('columns', [])
1521        format = request.data.get('format', 'list')
1522        model_variables = (
1523            request.data.get('variables') or self.model_variables)
1524        show_deleted = request.data.get('show_deleted', False)
1525        add_pk_column = request.data.get('add_pk_column', False)
1526        limit = request.data.get('limit', None)
1527
1528        if type(columns) is not list:
1529            raise exceptions.PumpWoodQueryException(
1530                'Columns must be a list of elements.')
1531        if len(set(columns) - set(model_variables)) != 0:
1532            raise exceptions.PumpWoodQueryException(
1533                'Column chosen as pivot is not at model variables')
1534
1535        index = list(set(model_variables) - set(columns))
1536        filter_dict = request.data.get('filter_dict', {})
1537        exclude_dict = request.data.get('exclude_dict', {})
1538        order_by = request.data.get('order_by', {})
1539
1540        if hasattr(self.service_model, 'deleted'):
1541            if not show_deleted:
1542                filter_dict["deleted"] = False
1543
1544        #############################
1545        # Add id columns to results #
1546        # TODO: Add other fields if set as composite primary key.
1547        if add_pk_column:
1548            if len(columns) != 0:
1549                raise exceptions.PumpWoodException(
1550                    "Can not add pk column and pivot information")
1551            model_variables = ['id'] + model_variables
1552
1553        # Limit pivot results if limit parameter is set
1554        query_set = self.service_model.objects.all()
1555        if limit is not None:
1556            query_set = query_set[:int(limit)]
1557
1558        arg_dict = {
1559            'query_set': query_set,
1560            'filter_dict': filter_dict, 'exclude_dict': exclude_dict,
1561            'order_by': order_by}
1562        query_set = filter_by_dict(**arg_dict)
1563
1564        try:
1565            filtered_objects_as_list = list(
1566                query_set.values_list(*(model_variables)))
1567        except TypeError as e:
1568            raise exceptions.PumpWoodQueryException(message=str(e))
1569
1570        melted_data = pd.DataFrame(
1571            filtered_objects_as_list, columns=model_variables)
1572
1573        if len(columns) == 0:
1574            return Response(melted_data.to_dict(format))
1575
1576        if melted_data.shape[0] == 0:
1577            return Response({})
1578        else:
1579            if "value" not in melted_data.columns:
1580                raise exceptions.PumpWoodQueryException(
1581                    "'value' column not at melted data, it is not possible"
1582                    " to pivot dataframe.")
1583
1584            pivoted_table = pd.pivot_table(
1585                melted_data, values='value', index=index,
1586                columns=columns, aggfunc=lambda x: tuple(x)[0])
1587
1588            return Response(
1589                pivoted_table.reset_index().to_dict(format))
1590
1591    def bulk_save(self, request) -> dict:
1592        r"""
1593        Bulk save data.
1594
1595        This end-point is prefereble for large datainputs on Pumpwood, it is
1596        not possible to update entries, just add new ones.
1597
1598        It is much more performant than adding one by one using save
1599        end-point.
1600
1601        ###### Request payload data:
1602        List of dictionaries which must have self.expected_cols_bulk_save.
1603
1604        ###### Request query data:
1605        No query parameters.
1606
1607        Args:
1608            request: Django request.
1609        Returns:
1610            A dictonary with key `saved_count` indicating the number of
1611            objects that were add to database.
1612        Raises:
1613            PumpWoodForbidden:
1614                'Bulk save not avaiable. Set expected_cols_bulk_save on
1615                PumpWoodDataBaseRestService View to habilitate funciton.'
1616                Indicates that bulk_save end-point was not configured
1617                for this model class. It is necessary to set
1618                `expected_cols_bulk_save` attribute to make end-point
1619                avaiable.
1620            PumpWoodObjectSavingException:
1621                'Post payload is a list of objects.'. Indicates that the
1622                request payload is not a list as expected.
1623            PumpWoodObjectSavingException:
1624                'Expected columns and data columns do not match:
1625                \nExpected columns:{expected}
1626                \nData columns:{data_cols}'. Indicates that the fields passed
1627                on the objects are diferent from the expected by the end-point
1628                check the data or the configuration of the end-point.
1629        """
1630        if len(self.expected_cols_bulk_save) == 0:
1631            msg = (
1632                "Bulk save not avaiable. Set expected_cols_bulk_save on "
1633                "PumpWoodDataBaseRestService View to habilitate funciton.")
1634            raise exceptions.PumpWoodForbidden(msg)
1635
1636        data_to_save = request.data
1637        if type(data_to_save) is not list:
1638            raise exceptions.PumpWoodObjectSavingException(
1639                'Post payload is a list of objects.')
1640
1641        pd_data_to_save = pd.DataFrame(data_to_save)
1642        pd_data_cols = set(list(pd_data_to_save.columns))
1643
1644        if len(set(self.expected_cols_bulk_save) - pd_data_cols) == 0:
1645            objects_to_load = []
1646            for d in data_to_save:
1647                new_obj = self.service_model(**d)
1648                objects_to_load.append(new_obj)
1649
1650            self.service_model.objects.bulk_create(objects_to_load)
1651            return Response({'saved_count': len(objects_to_load)})
1652        else:
1653            msg = (
1654                'Expected columns and data columns do not match:' +
1655                '\nExpected columns:{expected}' +
1656                '\nData columns:{data_cols}')
1657            raise exceptions.PumpWoodObjectSavingException(
1658                    message=msg,
1659                    payload={
1660                        "expected": list(self.expected_cols_bulk_save),
1661                        "data_cols": pd_data_cols})

1551            model_variables = ['id'] + model_variables
1552
1553        # Limit pivot results if limit parameter is set
1554        query_set = self.service_model.objects.all()
1555        if limit is not None:
1556            query_set = query_set[:int(limit)]
1557
1558        arg_dict = {
1559            'query_set': query_set,
1560            'filter_dict': filter_dict, 'exclude_dict': exclude_dict,
1561            'order_by': order_by}
1562        query_set = filter_by_dict(**arg_dict)
1563
1564        try:
1565            filtered_objects_as_list = list(
1566                query_set.values_list(*(model_variables)))
1567        except TypeError as e:
1568            raise exceptions.PumpWoodQueryException(message=str(e))
1569
1570        melted_data = pd.DataFrame(
1571            filtered_objects_as_list, columns=model_variables)
1572
1573        if len(columns) == 0:
1574            return Response(melted_data.to_dict(format))
1575
1576        if melted_data.shape[0] == 0:
1577            return Response({})
1578        else:
1579            if "value" not in melted_data.columns:
1580                raise exceptions.PumpWoodQueryException(
1581                    "'value' column not at melted data, it is not possible"
1582                    " to pivot dataframe.")
1583
1584            pivoted_table = pd.pivot_table(
1585                melted_data, values='value', index=index,
1586                columns=columns, aggfunc=lambda x: tuple(x)[0])
1587
1588            return Response(
1589                pivoted_table.reset_index().to_dict(format))

Pivot QuerySet data acording to columns selected, and filters passed.

Request payload data:

filter_dict, exclude_dict and order_by parameters have same behaviour as list end-point.

  • columns [List[str]]: List of variables that will be considered as collumns to pivot data.
  • format [{‘dict’, ‘list’, ‘series’, ‘split’, ‘tight’, ‘records’, ‘index’}]: Format paramter to convert pandas DataFrame to dictonary. This dictonary will be returned by the function.
  • variables [List[str]]: Variables to be returned, this will modify default behaviour of returning model_variables attribute fields.
  • show_deleted [bool]: If model has deleted field, results flaged as deleted won't be fetched. Setting show_deleted = True will return this filtered results.
  • add_pk_column [bool]: If True, pk columns will be added to results. Using pk columns will not permit to pivot information (makes no sense). So far only id column will be added to results treating composite pks is on the roadmap.
  • limit [int]: Limit of the query results (number of objects that will be returned).
Request query data:

No query parameters.

Returns:

Return a pandas DataFrame serialized according to format parameter.

Raises:
  • PumpWoodForbidden: 'Pivot is not avaiable, set model_variables at view'. Indicates that this end-point is not avaiable. To habilitate it, it is necessary to set model_variables attribute at view.
  • PumpWoodQueryException: 'Columns must be a list of elements.'. Indicates that columns type is not a list of strings.
  • PumpWoodQueryException: 'Column chosen as pivot is not at model variables'. Indicates that column is not present on model_variables attribute.
  • PumpWoodQueryException: Propagate errors raised when executing the query.
  • PumpWoodQueryException: 'value column not at melted data, it is not possible to pivot dataframe.'. Indicates that value column is not avaiable query results, so it not possible to pivot data.
def bulk_save(self, request) -> dict: 
1591    def bulk_save(self, request) -> dict:
1592        r"""
1593        Bulk save data.
1594
1595        This end-point is prefereble for large datainputs on Pumpwood, it is
1596        not possible to update entries, just add new ones.
1597
1598        It is much more performant than adding one by one using save
1599        end-point.
1600
1601        ###### Request payload data:
1602        List of dictionaries which must have self.expected_cols_bulk_save.
1603
1604        ###### Request query data:
1605        No query parameters.
1606
1607        Args:
1608            request: Django request.
1609        Returns:
1610            A dictonary with key `saved_count` indicating the number of
1611            objects that were add to database.
1612        Raises:
1613            PumpWoodForbidden:
1614                'Bulk save not avaiable. Set expected_cols_bulk_save on
1615                PumpWoodDataBaseRestService View to habilitate funciton.'
1616                Indicates that bulk_save end-point was not configured
1617                for this model class. It is necessary to set
1618                `expected_cols_bulk_save` attribute to make end-point
1619                avaiable.
1620            PumpWoodObjectSavingException:
1621                'Post payload is a list of objects.'. Indicates that the
1622                request payload is not a list as expected.
1623            PumpWoodObjectSavingException:
1624                'Expected columns and data columns do not match:
1625                \nExpected columns:{expected}
1626                \nData columns:{data_cols}'. Indicates that the fields passed
1627                on the objects are diferent from the expected by the end-point
1628                check the data or the configuration of the end-point.
1629        """
1630        if len(self.expected_cols_bulk_save) == 0:
1631            msg = (
1632                "Bulk save not avaiable. Set expected_cols_bulk_save on "
1633                "PumpWoodDataBaseRestService View to habilitate funciton.")
1634            raise exceptions.PumpWoodForbidden(msg)
1635
1636        data_to_save = request.data
1637        if type(data_to_save) is not list:
1638            raise exceptions.PumpWoodObjectSavingException(
1639                'Post payload is a list of objects.')
1640
1641        pd_data_to_save = pd.DataFrame(data_to_save)
1642        pd_data_cols = set(list(pd_data_to_save.columns))
1643
1644        if len(set(self.expected_cols_bulk_save) - pd_data_cols) == 0:
1645            objects_to_load = []
1646            for d in data_to_save:
1647                new_obj = self.service_model(**d)
1648                objects_to_load.append(new_obj)
1649
1650            self.service_model.objects.bulk_create(objects_to_load)
1651            return Response({'saved_count': len(objects_to_load)})
1652        else:
1653            msg = (
1654                'Expected columns and data columns do not match:' +
1655                '\nExpected columns:{expected}' +
1656                '\nData columns:{data_cols}')
1657            raise exceptions.PumpWoodObjectSavingException(
1658                    message=msg,
1659                    payload={
1660                        "expected": list(self.expected_cols_bulk_save),
1661                        "data_cols": pd_data_cols})

Bulk save data.

This end-point is prefereble for large datainputs on Pumpwood, it is not possible to update entries, just add new ones.

It is much more performant than adding one by one using save end-point.

Request payload data:

List of dictionaries which must have self.expected_cols_bulk_save.

Request query data:

No query parameters.

Arguments:
  • request: Django request.
Returns:

A dictonary with key saved_count indicating the number of objects that were add to database.

Raises:
  • PumpWoodForbidden: 'Bulk save not avaiable. Set expected_cols_bulk_save on PumpWoodDataBaseRestService View to habilitate funciton.' Indicates that bulk_save end-point was not configured for this model class. It is necessary to set expected_cols_bulk_save attribute to make end-point avaiable.
  • PumpWoodObjectSavingException: 'Post payload is a list of objects.'. Indicates that the request payload is not a list as expected.
  • PumpWoodObjectSavingException: 'Expected columns and data columns do not match: \nExpected columns:{expected} \nData columns:{data_cols}'. Indicates that the fields passed on the objects are diferent from the expected by the end-point check the data or the configuration of the end-point.
